title: Irregular typography?
content:
Does this term exist?

Is there an official term that summarizes erratic, wrong, dirty, broken, eroded,  
grungy type?

I ve been researching quite a bit on that for my diploma but I havent  
found one clear description for it.

Something that summarizes the phenomenon of \*\*\*\* type up,  
whether itd be in fine art, gebrauchsgrafik or typedesign.

so what do you think?
author: polenimschaufenster

comments.content:
I think of Neville Brody's experimentals  
 [http://www.fontshop.de/fuse95/fuse-talk/brody.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215103500/http:/www.fontshop.de/fuse95/fuse-talk/brody.html "http://www.fontshop.de/fuse95/fuse-talk/brody.html")

AS
I vote 'bad' + 'wrong' or quoting Kung Pow ' badong'

Some fonts merely have a deliberately jumpy baseline. Others go much further. I think there's a range in there. You've got hand-lettered, found type, etc. Grunge/distressed is what immediately comes to mind when you say 'dirty' or 'broken' though.
